metadata.title: CVE-2012-2947 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
chan_iax2.c in the IAX2 channel driver in Certified Asterisk 1.8.11-certbefore 1.8.11-cert2 and Asterisk Open Source 1.8.x before 1.8.12.1 and 10.xbefore 10.4.1, when a certain mohinterpret setting is enabled, allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) by placing acall on hold.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2947` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.8.13.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1').
